scope.description: Baseline engineering requirements library (superset) for turbines used in nuclear facilities (main steam turbines, auxiliary steam turbines, and turbine mechanical drives). Applicability is filtered by a TurbineProfile and project licensing basis.
scope.licensing_basis_assumption: US NRC-style framework (10 CFR Part 50/52) with code-of-record per 10 CFR 50.55a where applicable.
notes: This library is intentionally a superset. Not every requirement applies to every turbine configuration (condensing, backpressure, extraction, mechanical drive, generator-coupled).
Clause-level traceability (e.g., exact ASME/API/IEEE/NRC clause IDs) is expected to be added once the standards database is ingested and indexed.
Parameters and applicability conditions are designed for profile-driven filtering; projects may rename/normalize fields without changing schema.

requirements.text: The project shall define and record the licensing basis and code-of-record for the turbine and its auxiliaries, including applicable regulations, incorporated codes/standards, and edition/addenda where required.

verification.acceptance: A controlled licensing-basis and code-of-record record exists for the turbine.

requirements.text: The turbine system shall be classified (safety-related designation, seismic category, QA level, and code class) consistent with plant design basis and system functional requirements.

verification.acceptance: Classification and quality designation are documented and traceable to the system design basis.

requirements.text: The project shall establish design life, mission profile (e.g., baseload, cycling), and limiting transients for the turbine and document associated design cycles.

verification.acceptance: Design life, mission profile, and transient/cycle basis are documented and used in fatigue/aging evaluations.

requirements.text: The turbine specification shall define rated conditions (inlet pressure/temperature, exhaust pressure/backpressure, reheat/extraction conditions if applicable) and performance acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Procurement specification includes defined rated conditions and acceptance criteria for output and efficiency.

requirements.text: The project shall define the turbine system boundary and interfaces (steam, extraction/admission, drains/vents, lube oil, control/hydraulic oil, seal/gland steam, instrumentation, electrical) via controlled interface documents.

verification.acceptance: Interface control documents (ICDs/P&IDs) exist and cover all required physical and functional interfaces.

requirements.text: The project shall identify applicable environmental conditions for turbine-mounted instrumentation and electrical devices and specify qualification requirements where needed.

verification.acceptance: Environmental profile and required qualification basis are documented for applicable components.

requirements.text: The design shall include a hazard analysis addressing credible turbine hazards (overspeed, blade release/missile, steam leaks, oil fire, water induction) and associated protective measures.

verification.acceptance: Hazard analysis exists and protective features are captured in design requirements and drawings.

requirements.text: Where the turbine supports a safety function (e.g., turbine-driven safety pump), the design shall address single-failure considerations for the turbine and its control/protection functions.

verification.acceptance: Single-failure assumptions and resulting design provisions are documented for safety-function cases.

requirements.text: The project shall define required reliability and availability targets and include measures (redundancy, monitoring, maintainability) to meet them.

verification.acceptance: Reliability/availability targets and design measures are documented and verifiable.

requirements.text: The project shall define maintainability expectations, including outage access, lifting/handling, special tooling, and spare parts strategy for major assemblies (rotor, casing, valves, bearings).

verification.acceptance: Maintainability plan and maintainability-related design features (access, lifting points, tooling) are documented.

requirements.text: The turbine design shall incorporate configuration management expectations for setpoints and software/firmware in digital control/protection systems.

verification.acceptance: Configuration-controlled records exist for setpoints, logic, and firmware versions, with change control.

requirements.text: The procurement documents shall require vendor submittals including drawings, calculations, material certifications, test procedures/results, and operation/maintenance manuals.

verification.acceptance: A vendor data requirement list exists and is satisfied by controlled deliverables.

requirements.text: The project shall establish foreign material exclusion (FME) requirements for turbine assembly, maintenance, and steam path work to prevent FOD.

verification.acceptance: FME plan/procedures exist and are invoked for turbine work scopes.

requirements.text: The design shall specify nameplate and traceability markings (turbine tag, rating, rotation, critical clearances where applicable) consistent with plant configuration control.

verification.acceptance: Nameplate/marking requirements are specified and verified on delivered equipment.

requirements.text: The project shall define requirements for safe lifting/rigging and transport of major turbine components, including rotor shipping fixtures and casing handling.

verification.acceptance: Controlled handling and shipping requirements are documented and provided to suppliers/constructors.

requirements.text: The project shall define acceptance limits for vibration, bearing temperature, axial position, and other protection parameters for both steady-state and transient operation.

verification.acceptance: Acceptance limits and alarm/trip setpoints are documented and traceable to design analyses/standards.

requirements.text: The project shall define requirements for periodic inspection/condition monitoring intervals and required inspection access provisions (ports, borescope access, probe locations).

verification.acceptance: Inspection interval basis and access provisions are documented and reflected in drawings/specifications.

requirements.text: The project shall require a documented critical items list (CIL) identifying turbine components whose failure could challenge plant safety, availability, or major equipment integrity.

verification.acceptance: A controlled critical items list exists and is used to focus QA and maintenance planning.

requirements.text: The project shall specify preservation, storage, and layup requirements for the turbine and auxiliaries to prevent corrosion and contamination during outages or shipment/storage.

verification.acceptance: Preservation and layup requirements are documented and achievable with provided hardware/procedures.

requirements.text: The project shall specify personnel training and qualification expectations for operations/maintenance staff for turbine control, trip response, and routine surveillance.

verification.acceptance: Training requirements and materials are identified in project documentation and vendor manuals.

requirements.text: The project shall specify that reportable defects or nonconformances for safety-related turbine components are evaluated and reported consistent with applicable regulations.

verification.acceptance: Supplier and project procedures address reportability and documentation of defects/noncompliance.

requirements.text: The project shall define cybersecurity and access-control expectations for digital turbine control/protection systems consistent with plant cybersecurity program.

verification.acceptance: Cybersecurity controls (access, authentication, audit trails) are specified and implemented for digital systems.

requirements.text: Where a turbine is coupled to a generator, the project shall define interface requirements for torsional interaction, overspeed/load rejection, and protective coordination between turbine and generator systems.

verification.acceptance: Interface requirements and analyses exist for turbine-generator torsional and protection coordination.

requirements.text: The project shall define requirements for documentation retention and retrievability for turbine design and qualification records for the life of the plant as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Records retention and retrieval requirements are specified and implemented.

requirements.text: The project shall specify occupational safety and environmental constraints applicable to turbine installation and operation (e.g., guarding, hot surfaces, noise exposure) and incorporate them into design requirements.

verification.acceptance: Safety constraints (guarding, insulation, signage, noise) are specified in design/procurement documents.

requirements.text: The turbine inlet and exhaust interface nozzles (size, rating, orientation) shall be defined to support the required steam conditions and plant layout.

verification.acceptance: Nozzle interface data (drawings/specifications) is complete and matches plant piping design requirements.

requirements.text: The design shall specify allowable external nozzle loads and moments for all connected piping interfaces and provide guidance for piping flexibility analysis.

verification.acceptance: Allowable nozzle load tables are provided and used in piping stress/flexibility evaluation.

requirements.text: For condensing turbines, the exhaust hood and condenser interface (neck, expansion joint, vacuum boundary) shall be defined and compatible with condenser design pressure and alignment.

verification.acceptance: Exhaust hood/condenser interface drawings and tolerances are defined and reviewed for compatibility.

requirements.text: For backpressure turbines, the exhaust connection shall be defined to meet downstream process/heat load requirements and allowable backpressure limits.

verification.acceptance: Exhaust connection requirements and limits are specified and verified by design calculations.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include drains and vents at steam chests, casings, and low points to enable safe warmup, startup, and prevention of water induction.

verification.acceptance: P&IDs and equipment drawings show drains/vents and operating procedures address their use.

requirements.text: Steam chest warmup provisions (warming lines, bypass, controlled heating) shall be provided to limit thermal gradients and casing distortion during startup.

verification.acceptance: Warmup provisions are included and startup procedures limit thermal gradients per design basis.

requirements.text: Water induction protection features (drain logic, level monitoring, traps, interlocks) shall be defined for turbines susceptible to condensate carryover or startup transients.

verification.acceptance: Water induction hazards are addressed by design features and documented interlocks/procedures.

requirements.text: Where reheat is used, reheat stop and intercept valve interfaces and control logic boundaries shall be defined (actuation, closure time, position feedback).

verification.acceptance: Valve interface and control requirements are defined in ICDs and control system design documents.

requirements.text: Where extractions/admissions are present, the number of extraction points, pressure/flow requirements, and non-return protection interfaces shall be defined.

verification.acceptance: Extraction/admission interface requirements and protection provisions are documented.

requirements.text: Seal/gland steam system interfaces (supply pressure control, leakoff routing, exhauster connection) shall be defined and compatible with plant auxiliary systems.

verification.acceptance: Gland steam interface requirements are defined and validated against plant auxiliary system design.

requirements.text: The turbine lube oil supply/return interface, including isolation, drains, vents, and contamination control provisions, shall be defined.

verification.acceptance: Oil interface connections and isolation/drain provisions are shown on drawings and P&IDs.

requirements.text: If a separate hydraulic/control oil system is used for valve actuation, the interfaces (HPU, accumulators, filters, return) shall be defined and compatible with control system requirements.

verification.acceptance: Hydraulic/control oil interface requirements are documented and reflected in design diagrams.

requirements.text: Turning gear (barring) interface requirements (mounting, torque capacity, speed, power supply, interlocks) shall be defined for rotors requiring cooldown rotation.

verification.acceptance: Turning gear interface and interlock requirements are specified and validated against rotor cooldown needs.

requirements.text: Jacking oil system interfaces (supply, controls, interlocks with turning gear and lube oil) shall be defined where required by bearing design.

verification.acceptance: Jacking oil interface and interlocks are defined and verified in drawings and logic diagrams.

requirements.text: Coupling and alignment interfaces (hub types, spacer length, axial float, access for removal) shall be defined for the turbine-to-driven equipment connection.

verification.acceptance: Coupling interface drawing and alignment requirements are provided and meet maintainability constraints.

requirements.text: Where a gearbox is present, the turbine-gearbox interface (torsional characteristics, lubrication, alignment, guarding) shall be defined.

verification.acceptance: Interface data and analyses exist for the turbine/gearbox train and guarding requirements are defined.

requirements.text: The foundation and soleplate interface shall define anchor bolt pattern, grouting, leveling, and alignment reference points for installation.

verification.acceptance: Installation drawings define foundation interface data and alignment reference features.

requirements.text: The design shall define insulation/lagging requirements and support provisions to control heat loss and protect personnel from hot surfaces.

verification.acceptance: Insulation requirements and support features are defined and meet safety/thermal needs.

requirements.text: The turbine package shall include defined access clearances for routine surveillance, instrument calibration, and maintenance removal paths for major components.

verification.acceptance: General arrangement drawings demonstrate access clearances and removal paths.

requirements.text: Electrical interface requirements (power supplies, grounding, signal types, networking) shall be defined for turbine auxiliaries and controls.

verification.acceptance: Electrical interface requirements are documented and consistent with plant electrical design standards.

requirements.text: The design shall define interface requirements for local control panels, local emergency trip stations, and remote control room indications.

verification.acceptance: Panel/station locations and signal requirements are captured in drawings and I&C design documents.

requirements.text: Fire protection interfaces (oil system drains, fire detection/suppression actuation signals, barriers) shall be defined where oil fire hazards exist.

verification.acceptance: Fire protection interfaces are specified and coordinated with plant fire protection design.

requirements.text: The turbine shall provide provisions for safe venting and drainage during maintenance, including lockable isolation points and drain connections.

verification.acceptance: Maintenance vent/drain provisions are present and documented in procedures/drawings.

requirements.text: The design shall define connections/provisions for performance testing instrumentation (pressure/temperature taps, flow measurement provisions) where contractual testing is required.

verification.acceptance: Test connections and measurement provisions are identified for required performance tests.

requirements.text: The turbine package shall define shipping and installation constraints (orientation, allowable transport accelerations, preservation, lifting points).

verification.acceptance: Shipping/installation constraints are documented and included in vendor instructions.

requirements.text: The turbine shall meet the specified rated power output at rated inlet and exhaust conditions, including any specified reheat and extraction conditions.

verification.acceptance: Performance calculations and/or PTC 6 test results demonstrate rated output is achieved within specified tolerances.

requirements.text: The turbine shall meet the specified efficiency/heat rate (or steam rate) target at rated conditions within defined acceptance tolerances.

verification.acceptance: PTC 6 performance test or validated model demonstrates heat rate/efficiency within acceptance tolerance.

requirements.text: The turbine shall demonstrate stable operation over the specified load range (including minimum stable load) without surge, hunting, or unacceptable vibration.

verification.acceptance: Test results or analyses show stable control and acceptable vibration across the specified operating range.

requirements.text: The turbine shall accommodate specified variations in inlet steam pressure and temperature while maintaining operability and protection setpoint margins.

verification.acceptance: Analyses and/or test demonstrate operability and protection margins over defined inlet condition envelope.

requirements.text: For condensing turbines, the turbine shall meet performance requirements across the specified condenser pressure (vacuum) range.

verification.acceptance: Performance curves and/or test results demonstrate compliance across the condenser pressure range.

requirements.text: For backpressure turbines, the turbine shall meet performance requirements across the specified exhaust/backpressure range.

verification.acceptance: Performance curves demonstrate compliance across the specified backpressure range.

requirements.text: The turbine shall meet specified ramp-rate capability and load-following requirements without exceeding thermal stress limits or protection setpoints.

verification.acceptance: Transient analysis and/or site tests demonstrate ramping without exceeding defined thermal or protection limits.

requirements.text: The turbine shall meet specified cold, warm, and hot start time requirements, including required warmup steps and hold points.

verification.acceptance: Startup procedures and test/analysis demonstrate achievable start times within constraints.

requirements.text: The turbine shall tolerate specified load rejection events without mechanical damage, unacceptable overspeed excursions, or loss of protective function.

verification.acceptance: Load rejection analysis and/or tests demonstrate overspeed and mechanical responses remain within allowable limits.

requirements.text: The turbine governing system shall maintain speed regulation within specified limits during steady-state and transient operation as required by its application.

verification.acceptance: Control system tests demonstrate speed regulation meets specified percent deviation.

requirements.text: Where the turbine provides extraction steam, the turbine shall meet extraction pressure/flow control requirements at the defined operating points.

verification.acceptance: Extraction control performance is demonstrated by analysis/test against specified extraction setpoints.

requirements.text: Where extraction is used, the turbine shall prevent reverse flow through extraction lines via non-return devices or protective controls to preclude turbine damage.

verification.acceptance: Design includes non-return valves/interlocks and their function is verified by inspection/test.

requirements.text: The turbine shall limit moisture content in low-pressure stages consistent with steam path erosion limits and specified moisture carryover requirements.

verification.acceptance: Steam path analysis or test demonstrates moisture content remains below specified limit at operating points.

requirements.text: The turbine shall tolerate defined levels of steam purity and carryover (salts/solids) consistent with erosion/corrosion constraints and monitoring program.

verification.acceptance: Steam purity limits and monitoring provisions are defined and linked to turbine material/erosion assumptions.

requirements.text: The turbine shall meet specified acoustic noise limits at defined measurement locations during steady operation.

verification.acceptance: Noise measurements demonstrate compliance with specified dBA limits.

requirements.text: The turbine shall provide defined performance curves (output, heat rate, steam flow) versus load and key boundary conditions for operations planning and verification.

verification.acceptance: Vendor provides performance maps/curves in controlled documentation.

requirements.text: The turbine shall achieve specified shaft power across the operating envelope for mechanical drive applications, including defined speed and torque requirements.

verification.acceptance: Mechanical drive performance is demonstrated via analysis/test at defined speed/torque points.

requirements.text: The turbine shall be capable of continuous operation at maximum continuous rating (MCR) with defined margins to protection setpoints and thermal limits.

verification.acceptance: Analysis/test demonstrates operation at MCR without exceeding alarm/trip thresholds or thermal limits.

requirements.text: The turbine shall incorporate defined limitations for operation under off-design conditions (e.g., low steam flow, high exhaust pressure) and provide operator guidance.

verification.acceptance: Operating limits are documented and provided in operating instructions and control system alarms.

requirements.text: The turbine shall meet specified startup steam consumption and auxiliary steam requirements where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Startup steam consumption is documented and meets specified limits or design assumptions.

requirements.text: The turbine shall provide defined trip-to-idle or coastdown behavior consistent with driven equipment requirements and protection logic.

verification.acceptance: Coastdown/decay characteristics are analyzed/tested and compatible with coupled equipment and protection settings.

requirements.text: Where coupled to a generator, the turbine shall support required grid frequency operation (e.g., 50/60 Hz) and speed margins without violating mechanical limits.

verification.acceptance: Analyses/tests demonstrate acceptable operation over specified frequency range and associated speed variation.

requirements.text: The turbine shall provide provisions for online performance monitoring (heat rate/efficiency trending) or defined periodic performance assessment method.

verification.acceptance: Performance monitoring method and required measurements are defined and implemented.

requirements.text: The turbine shall meet specified availability and maintainability assumptions used in plant economic and operational planning, including repair times for major modules.

verification.acceptance: Maintainability assumptions and modularity/spares provisions support target repair times.

requirements.text: The turbine shall maintain acceptable bearing temperatures and oil temperatures over the operating envelope at defined ambient conditions.

verification.acceptance: Thermal analysis and/or tests show bearing/oil temperatures remain within specified limits across the envelope.

requirement_sets.category: 4. Mechanical design, rotordynamics, and structural integrity

requirements.text: The rotor and blading shall be designed for the defined maximum overspeed condition and demonstrate acceptable stresses with required margins.

verification.acceptance: Stress analysis demonstrates rotor and blading meet allowable stress limits at defined overspeed with documented margins.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include an independent overspeed trip system set to the specified overspeed trip setpoint and verified by test.

verification.acceptance: Overspeed trip setpoint is documented, independently implemented, and successfully tested.

requirements.text: The rotor dynamic design shall demonstrate acceptable separation margins between operating speeds and critical speeds, including during transients and coastdown.

verification.acceptance: Rotordynamic analysis shows critical speed separation margin meets specified requirement.

requirements.text: The rotor dynamic design shall address stability (e.g., oil whirl/whip) for the full operating envelope and defined steam conditions.

verification.acceptance: Stability analysis demonstrates positive damping and no unstable regions in the operating envelope.

requirements.text: The turbine shall meet specified vibration limits at bearings and casing during steady operation and defined transients.

verification.acceptance: Shop/site tests demonstrate vibration levels are within specified acceptance limits.

requirements.text: The turbine shall implement vibration trip logic consistent with protection philosophy and defined trip thresholds to prevent damage.

verification.acceptance: Protection system enforces trip thresholds and trip tests demonstrate correct response.

requirements.text: The rotor shall be balanced to the specified balance grade and verified by shop balance records and mechanical run testing.

verification.acceptance: Balance reports and run test data demonstrate balance meets specified grade and vibration acceptance limits.

requirements.text: A torsional vibration analysis shall be performed for the turbine train (including couplings, gearbox, generator/driven equipment) to confirm acceptable torsional stresses and avoid resonances.

verification.acceptance: Torsional analysis report exists and demonstrates acceptable torsional stress and separation margins.

requirements.text: The turbine shall be designed to limit axial thrust and provide thrust bearing capacity and margins for all operating conditions and transients.

verification.acceptance: Thrust calculations demonstrate thrust bearing capacity with margin across operating/transient cases.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include axial position monitoring and protection setpoints to detect thrust bearing distress or abnormal axial movement.

verification.acceptance: Axial position instrumentation and alarm/trip setpoints are provided and verified by functional test.

requirements.text: Thermal growth and casing expansion effects shall be evaluated and accommodated via alignment and support design to prevent rubs and misalignment.

verification.acceptance: Thermal growth analysis supports alignment targets and expansion monitoring strategy.

requirements.text: Where differential expansion monitoring is required, sensors and setpoints shall be provided to prevent rotor-to-casing rub due to transient thermal gradients.

verification.acceptance: Differential expansion monitoring exists and alarms/trips are verified in functional testing.

requirements.text: The casing and supports shall be designed to withstand defined external loads (piping, thermal, seismic where applicable) without distortion that compromises clearances.

verification.acceptance: Structural analysis demonstrates allowable distortion and stress limits are satisfied.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include provisions for alignment checks (reference marks, jacking bolts, leveling pads) to support installation and periodic alignment verification.

verification.acceptance: Design includes alignment reference features and installation procedures specify alignment checks.

requirements.text: The turbine foundation/soleplate design shall be evaluated for dynamic response to rotating forces and shall avoid amplification at operating frequencies.

verification.acceptance: Foundation dynamic analysis demonstrates acceptable dynamic response and avoids resonance near operating speed.

requirements.text: The turbine shall be designed for specified start/stop cycling and thermal transients, including fatigue evaluation for critical components.

verification.acceptance: Fatigue evaluation exists and demonstrates acceptable cumulative usage factor or equivalent margin.

requirements.text: Rotor forging and critical rotating components shall meet material quality and inspection requirements suitable for high-energy rotors, including defect limits and traceability.

verification.acceptance: Material certifications and inspection records meet specified requirements for critical rotating components.

requirements.text: The design shall include containment/guarding measures to mitigate credible rotor/blade release or fragment hazards, consistent with plant safety and personnel protection requirements.

verification.acceptance: Containment/guarding features are defined and hazard analysis demonstrates acceptable mitigation.

requirements.text: The turbine shall maintain defined minimum clearances between rotor and stationary parts under all operating conditions, including worst-case thermal and mechanical deflections.

verification.acceptance: Clearance analysis demonstrates minimum clearances are maintained with documented margins.

requirements.text: The turbine shall incorporate rubbing-resistant materials or sacrificial elements where appropriate to reduce damage risk during minor rub events.

verification.acceptance: Material selection and design details identify rubbing-resistant elements where required.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include provisions to prevent or mitigate torsional transients from electrical faults or load rejection when coupled to a generator.

verification.acceptance: Torsional transient analysis covers electrical fault/load rejection cases and demonstrates acceptable stresses.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include speed measurement redundancy sufficient to support control and independent protection functions as required by the safety/availability classification.

verification.acceptance: Speed sensing architecture supports required redundancy and is verified by inspection/functional test.

requirements.text: The design shall specify limits and controls for rotor eccentricity and shall provide eccentricity monitoring where needed for large, flexible rotors.

verification.acceptance: Eccentricity monitoring is provided when required and alarms/trips are verified.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include appropriate coupling guarding and rotating equipment guarding to prevent personnel contact with rotating parts.

verification.acceptance: Guarding is provided and meets plant safety requirements; inspection verifies coverage and access control.

requirements.text: The turbine design shall include provisions for safe barring/turning during cooldown and for preventing inadvertent startup while on turning gear.

verification.acceptance: Interlocks prevent startup on turning gear and turning gear function is verified during commissioning tests.

requirement_sets.category: 5. Steam path, blading, erosion/corrosion, and deposits

requirements.text: Steam path aerodynamic design shall be documented and demonstrate that blading and diaphragms meet efficiency targets and stall margins across the operating envelope.

verification.acceptance: Steam path design documentation and performance predictions demonstrate compliance with efficiency and stability targets.

requirements.text: The steam path shall be designed to control moisture and droplet erosion, including provisions such as moisture removal features or optimized last-stage blade design.

verification.acceptance: Analysis demonstrates moisture/erosion assumptions are satisfied and design includes moisture control features as required.

requirements.text: Last-stage blades and associated attachments shall be evaluated for centrifugal stress, vibratory stress, and resonance avoidance at operating speed and overspeed conditions.

verification.acceptance: Stress and resonance analyses demonstrate acceptable margins for last-stage blades across conditions.

requirements.text: Blade natural frequencies and mode shapes shall be assessed to avoid resonances with nozzle passing frequency, harmonics, and expected excitation sources.

verification.acceptance: Campbell/FE analyses show adequate separation margins from excitation frequencies.

requirements.text: Blade and diaphragm materials shall be selected for wet steam corrosion/erosion resistance and compatibility with expected chemistry and steam purity conditions.

verification.acceptance: Material selections are justified and documented against erosion/corrosion and chemistry assumptions.

requirements.text: Where brush seals or advanced sealing is used, seal materials and clearances shall be selected to maintain performance while avoiding rub-induced damage and particulate generation.

verification.acceptance: Seal design documentation shows materials/clearances meet performance and rub tolerance requirements.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include steam path cleanliness and FME requirements for assembly and maintenance to prevent foreign object damage and efficiency degradation.

verification.acceptance: FME and cleanliness requirements are specified and verified during assembly/maintenance activities.

requirements.text: The design shall include erosion shielding or coatings in regions susceptible to droplet erosion (e.g., leading edges, last-stage blades) where analysis indicates need.

verification.acceptance: Coatings/shields are specified where required by erosion analysis and verified by inspection.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include provisions to prevent solid particle erosion during startup (e.g., warmup, blowdown, strainers) consistent with steam supply characteristics.

verification.acceptance: Design and procedures address SPE risks during startup and transients.

requirements.text: The turbine shall define allowable steam purity and carryover limits (e.g., sodium/chloride) to protect steam path surfaces and shall specify monitoring requirements.

verification.acceptance: Steam purity limits and required monitoring are stated in specifications and operating guidance.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include drainage features in stages/diaphragms where required to remove accumulated moisture and reduce erosion risk.

verification.acceptance: Design drawings show stage drains and routing consistent with operating philosophy.

requirements.text: The steam path shall be designed to tolerate defined deposit/fouling levels and provide maintainable access for cleaning/inspection where deposit formation is plausible.

verification.acceptance: Access provisions and maintenance methods are documented and feasible for deposit-prone regions.

requirements.text: Where online washing or cleaning is specified, the turbine shall provide injection/collection provisions and controls to avoid damage and ensure safe operation.

verification.acceptance: Online cleaning provisions and procedures are documented and validated by test/analysis.

requirements.text: The turbine shall incorporate measures to prevent interstage seal degradation and steam leakage that could materially impact performance and rotor stability.

verification.acceptance: Seal design and monitoring strategy support leakage control and documented performance impact limits.

requirements.text: Steam path components shall be designed for differential thermal expansion and shall avoid binding/rubbing across expected transient temperature gradients.

verification.acceptance: Thermal and clearance analyses demonstrate no unacceptable rub risk during transients.

requirements.text: Where extraction/admission ports are present, steam path geometry and control shall prevent adverse flow patterns that could drive blade vibration or erosion.

verification.acceptance: Flow path evaluation demonstrates extraction/admission features do not create damaging flow excitation.

requirements.text: The design shall include provisions to prevent or mitigate corrosion fatigue or stress corrosion cracking in susceptible steam path alloys under expected wet steam conditions.

verification.acceptance: Material selection and stress/corrosion evaluation demonstrate acceptable SCC/CF margins.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include provisions for periodic borescope inspection of critical steam path regions where condition monitoring indicates need.

verification.acceptance: Borescope access points and inspection procedures are provided and documented.

requirements.text: The turbine shall provide defined criteria for steam path refurbishment (blade replacement, coating renewal, seal replacement) based on measured wear and performance degradation.

verification.acceptance: Refurbishment criteria are documented in maintenance manuals and based on measurable indicators.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include robust fastener retention and anti-loosening measures for steam path hardware subjected to vibration and thermal cycling.

verification.acceptance: Design details and calculations demonstrate adequate retention and anti-loosening measures.

requirements.text: Steam path design shall include provisions to prevent water droplet impingement on vulnerable surfaces during startup/shutdown through drain control and valve sequencing.

verification.acceptance: Operating sequences and drain provisions mitigate droplet impingement risks; verified by analysis/procedure review.

requirements.text: The turbine shall provide design documentation sufficient to support periodic performance evaluation and root-cause analysis of heat rate degradation.

verification.acceptance: Steam path design documentation and performance baseline are delivered and configuration controlled.

requirements.text: The turbine shall define acceptable clearances and wear limits for labyrinth seals and other clearanced steam path components, with measurement methods.

verification.acceptance: Wear limits and measurement methods are documented in maintenance instructions.

requirements.text: Where applicable, the turbine design shall incorporate measures to reduce aerodynamic instabilities such as flutter in long blades through damping features or design selection.

verification.acceptance: Flutter/damping analyses demonstrate acceptable stability margins for long blades.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include protections against ingestion of foreign objects from upstream piping (e.g., strainers/screens) when required by system hazards analysis.

verification.acceptance: Upstream FOD protection requirements are defined and implemented where needed.

requirement_sets.category: 6. Pressure boundary, casing, valves, and piping interfaces

requirements.text: The turbine casing(s) and steam chest pressure boundaries shall be designed for defined design pressure and temperature, including applicable transient allowances, with documented margins.

verification.acceptance: Pressure boundary calculations demonstrate compliance with design pressure/temperature and defined margins.

requirements.text: Pressure boundary materials shall meet specified material standards and traceability requirements, including heat treatment and mechanical properties.

verification.acceptance: Material certificates and traceability records meet specified requirements for pressure boundary parts.

requirements.text: Welding procedures and welder qualifications for turbine pressure boundary fabrication shall be qualified and controlled per applicable welding standards.

verification.acceptance: Qualified WPS/PQR and welder qualification records are provided and controlled.

requirements.text: Nondestructive examination (NDE) for pressure boundary welds and critical forgings shall be performed per defined NDE procedures and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: NDE procedures and results demonstrate compliance with acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: The casing shall be hydrostatically or pneumatically tested as required by the code-of-record or procurement specification, with defined leak acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Pressure test procedures and results meet specified acceptance criteria with documented test conditions.

requirements.text: The design shall provide provisions for safe venting and drainage of pressure boundaries during maintenance and startup, including lockable isolation points.

verification.acceptance: Venting/drain provisions and isolation points are present and documented in drawings/procedures.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include clearly defined bolting requirements (material, preload, lubrication, tightening sequence) for casing joints and critical flanges.

verification.acceptance: Bolting specification and assembly procedures are provided and used during installation/maintenance.

requirements.text: Casing joint designs shall include measures to ensure repeatable sealing performance across thermal cycles (gaskets, joint stiffness, alignment features).

verification.acceptance: Joint design documentation demonstrates sealing performance and includes repeatable alignment features.

requirements.text: The design shall define allowable casing distortion and support strategy (feet, sliding keys, anchors) to accommodate thermal expansion while maintaining alignment.

verification.acceptance: Support strategy and distortion limits are documented; alignment analysis supports the approach.

requirements.text: Steam inlet, extraction, and exhaust connections shall be designed to avoid flow-induced forces or vibration that could damage the casing or attached piping.

verification.acceptance: Flow-induced load/vibration assessment demonstrates acceptable forces and no damaging vibration risk.

requirements.text: The turbine shall define casing insulation requirements and provide insulation support features that do not compromise inspection access or sealing surfaces.

verification.acceptance: Insulation requirements and supports are documented and do not obstruct critical inspection/maintenance access.

requirements.text: Stop and control valve interfaces (if supplied with the turbine) shall define pressure rating, leakage class, closure time, and position feedback requirements.

verification.acceptance: Valve interface specifications include rating, leakage, closure time, and feedback requirements.

requirements.text: Valve closure times for stop/control/intercept valves shall be specified and verified to meet overspeed and turbine protection requirements without inducing unacceptable hydraulic transients.

verification.acceptance: Closure time verification and transient evaluation demonstrate acceptable turbine protection response and system transients.

requirements.text: The turbine shall incorporate strainers/screens or other upstream protection where system analysis indicates risk of debris ingestion into valves or steam chest.

verification.acceptance: Design includes upstream protection where required by hazard analysis and is documented on P&IDs.

requirements.text: The design shall specify sealing/packing requirements for valve stems and pressure boundary penetrations to minimize steam leakage and meet plant leak control expectations.

verification.acceptance: Specified packing/seal design meets leak control requirements and is documented in maintenance instructions.

requirements.text: Where applicable, the design shall include provisions to prevent steam leaks from creating personnel hazards (shielding, insulation, routing of leakoff) and support leak detection.

verification.acceptance: Shielding/insulation and leak detection provisions are provided and shown on drawings.

requirements.text: Pressure boundary penetrations for instrumentation (pressure/temperature taps) shall be designed and installed per applicable piping/pressure boundary practices.

verification.acceptance: Penetrations meet specified design practices and are documented/inspected for compliance.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include provisions for controlled warming and controlled pressurization to avoid thermal shock and casing cracking.

verification.acceptance: Startup requirements and design features limit thermal shock; documented in procedures and analyses.

requirements.text: The turbine exhaust hood and diffuser (if applicable) shall be designed to avoid excessive pressure losses and accommodate condensate drainage to prevent water carryover.

verification.acceptance: Exhaust hood design meets pressure loss targets and includes drainage provisions.

requirements.text: The turbine shall specify requirements for steam line drains/traps upstream to minimize condensate slugs entering the turbine, including coordination with piping design.

verification.acceptance: Drain/trap requirements are documented and coordinated with piping design drawings and procedures.

requirements.text: Where applicable, the design shall define overpressure and relief provisions for trapped volumes in turbine casings/valve chests (thermal relief or vents).

verification.acceptance: Trapped volume relief/venting requirements are documented and implemented.

requirements.text: The turbine shall define acceptable leakage limits for casing joints and pressure boundary interfaces under defined test conditions.

verification.acceptance: Leak test results meet specified leakage limits and are documented.

requirements.text: The turbine shall define requirements for alignment and concentricity of casing bores and diaphragms to maintain clearances and performance.

verification.acceptance: Manufacturing/assembly records demonstrate alignment/concentricity within specified tolerances.

requirements.text: The design shall include provisions for safe access and rigging of heavy pressure boundary components (upper casings, valve chests) during maintenance.

verification.acceptance: Lifting lugs, rigging points, and maintenance instructions support safe removal/installation.

requirements.text: The turbine shall define interfaces and requirements for steam admission bypass or warming bypass systems (if provided), including control logic and protection interlocks.

verification.acceptance: Bypass system interface requirements and interlocks are documented and verified by design review.

requirement_sets.category: 7. Bearings, seals, lubrication, and auxiliary fluid systems

requirements.text: The turbine shall include a lubrication oil system designed to provide continuous lubrication to all bearings under all operating modes, including startup, shutdown, and coastdown.

verification.acceptance: Oil system design demonstrates continuous lubrication supply for all modes; documented in P&IDs and calculations.

requirements.text: The lube oil system shall include redundancy consistent with reliability classification (e.g., 2x100% pumps or N+1) and defined automatic switchover logic.

verification.acceptance: Design includes required redundancy and automatic switchover; functional tests demonstrate proper switchover.

requirements.text: An emergency lubrication capability (e.g., DC-driven pump, gravity tank, accumulator) shall be provided where loss of AC power could otherwise damage bearings during coastdown.

verification.acceptance: Emergency lubrication capability is provided and verified by test/analysis for worst-case power loss coastdown.

requirements.text: Lube oil reservoir capacity shall be sufficient for heat soak, pump suction requirements, and defined hold-up volumes, with level monitoring and alarms.

verification.acceptance: Reservoir sizing calculations support capacity and level instrumentation provides alarms/trips as specified.

requirements.text: The lube oil system shall include temperature control (coolers/heaters) to maintain oil viscosity within required limits across ambient conditions.

verification.acceptance: Oil temperature control maintains oil temperature within specified range under test/analysis conditions.

requirements.text: Oil cleanliness requirements (e.g., ISO cleanliness code) shall be specified, and filtration arrangements shall be designed to achieve and maintain that cleanliness.

verification.acceptance: Filtration design supports target ISO cleanliness and verification testing demonstrates achieved cleanliness.

requirements.text: The lube oil system shall include duplex filters or bypass arrangements to allow filter change without loss of lubrication.

verification.acceptance: Filter arrangement supports online maintenance; demonstration or inspection confirms changeover capability.

requirements.text: Oil system piping and components shall include provisions for flushing/cleaning to defined cleanliness acceptance criteria prior to commissioning.

verification.acceptance: Oil flush procedures and results demonstrate achievement of cleanliness acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Bearing types and sizes shall be selected to support rotor loads, stability, and life requirements, with documented margins for load and temperature.

verification.acceptance: Bearing calculations demonstrate load capacity and temperature margins for all operating cases.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include thrust bearing arrangements sufficient to accommodate axial thrust in all conditions, with monitoring of thrust bearing temperature and axial position.

verification.acceptance: Thrust bearing monitoring (temperature/axial position) is installed and verified; capacity is supported by analysis.

requirements.text: Bearing metal temperature sensors shall be provided for all journal and thrust bearings, with alarm/trip setpoints consistent with bearing design limits.

verification.acceptance: Sensors exist and setpoints are configured and verified by functional test; setpoints trace to design limits.

requirements.text: The lube oil system shall include oil pressure monitoring and low-pressure trip/alarm logic to protect bearings during abnormal conditions.

verification.acceptance: Low oil pressure alarms/trips are implemented and verified by functional testing.

requirements.text: Oil coolers shall be designed with isolation and bypass capability to permit maintenance while sustaining oil temperature control where required.

verification.acceptance: Cooler isolation/bypass provisions exist and are documented in P&IDs and maintenance procedures.

requirements.text: Oil system leakage control measures (seals, drains, containment) shall be provided to prevent oil spills and reduce fire hazards.

verification.acceptance: Leakage control features are provided and oil spill containment/drainage is documented.

requirements.text: Where oil fire hazards exist, the turbine package shall include fire detection and mitigation provisions appropriate to plant fire protection design (e.g., oil mist detection, deluge interfaces).

verification.acceptance: Fire detection/mitigation provisions are defined and coordinated with plant fire protection systems.

requirements.text: Shaft sealing (gland) system design shall minimize air ingress and steam leakage while maintaining stable vacuum (condensing turbines) and protecting bearings from moisture.

verification.acceptance: Seal system performance is validated by analysis/test, including vacuum stability and leak control.

requirements.text: Gland seal exhauster (if used) shall be sized and controlled to maintain required seal pressure differentials across operating conditions, with monitoring and alarms.

verification.acceptance: Sizing calculations and functional tests demonstrate seal pressure control within specified range.

requirements.text: Seal leakage and leakoff routing shall be designed to avoid contamination of lube oil and to route steam/air mixture to appropriate systems (condenser or vent).

verification.acceptance: Leakoff routing is documented and prevents contamination of oil system; verified by inspection.

requirements.text: The design shall include measures to prevent moisture ingress to bearings and oil system during turbine washdown, steam leaks, or condenser vacuum excursions.

verification.acceptance: Design includes barriers/drains and monitoring; verified by design review and inspection.

requirements.text: Jacking oil systems, where provided, shall supply adequate lift pressure prior to rotor rotation and shall be interlocked with turning gear and main lube oil.

verification.acceptance: Jacking oil pressure and interlocks are verified by functional test and commissioning procedures.

requirements.text: Turning gear lubrication requirements and bearing temperature monitoring shall support extended barring operation during cooldown without exceeding bearing limits.

verification.acceptance: Turning gear operating mode maintains acceptable bearing temperatures; verified by analysis/test.

requirements.text: Oil system instrumentation shall include temperature, pressure, flow, and differential pressure indications adequate for operations and troubleshooting.

verification.acceptance: Instrumentation list and P&IDs include required measurements and are reflected in control room/local displays.

requirements.text: The lube oil system shall include sampling points and provisions for oil analysis program implementation (e.g., moisture, particulate, TAN) to support condition monitoring.

verification.acceptance: Sampling points are provided and oil analysis program requirements are documented.

requirements.text: Seal system and oil system components shall be designed to allow replacement of seals, bearings, and filters with reasonable outage durations and minimal special tooling.

verification.acceptance: Maintenance procedures and design features support removal/replacement within defined outage constraints.

requirements.text: Where shared plant oil systems are used, interfaces and responsibilities shall be clearly defined, including contamination control boundaries and trip logic coordination.

verification.acceptance: Interface documents define boundaries, responsibilities, and control/protection coordination for shared systems.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include a governing/control system capable of maintaining required speed and load control performance for its application.

verification.acceptance: Control functional tests and performance demonstrations meet specified control accuracy and stability requirements.

requirements.text: The turbine control system shall implement safe startup, synchronization (if generator-coupled), loading, unloading, and shutdown sequences with defined interlocks.

verification.acceptance: Sequence logic is documented and functional tests demonstrate correct interlocks and step progression.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include an independent emergency trip function that rapidly shuts off steam admission upon detection of trip conditions or manual activation.

verification.acceptance: Emergency trip function is independent, failsafe, and verified by trip testing with measured closure times.

requirements.text: Overspeed protection shall be implemented with independence from the primary governor and shall be designed to fail-safe on loss of power or control signal as required.

verification.acceptance: Design demonstrates independence and fail-safe behavior; overspeed tests verify correct actuation.

requirements.text: Trip system architecture (e.g., 1oo2, 2oo3) shall be selected to meet reliability requirements and minimize spurious trips consistent with safety/availability goals.

verification.acceptance: Trip architecture selection and reliability rationale are documented; design matches specified architecture.

requirements.text: The control system shall include valve position feedback and diagnostics for stop/control/intercept valves to detect sticking, slow closure, or loss of actuation pressure.

verification.acceptance: Valve feedback and diagnostics are implemented and validated by functional test.

requirements.text: Hydraulic actuation systems shall include accumulator capacity and redundancy adequate to close valves on trip under worst-case conditions (e.g., loss of power).

verification.acceptance: Accumulator sizing and functional tests demonstrate valve closure on trip under worst-case power/hydraulic conditions.

requirements.text: The control system shall include permissives and interlocks to prevent steam admission when turning gear is engaged or when lube oil pressure is inadequate.

verification.acceptance: Interlocks are documented and verified; attempted starts under prohibited conditions are prevented.

requirements.text: The turbine protection system shall monitor bearing temperature, vibration, axial position, and other critical parameters and initiate alarms/trips per defined setpoints.

verification.acceptance: Protection channels and setpoints are configured and verified by functional tests and calibrated inputs.

requirements.text: Protection for low lube oil pressure, high lube oil temperature, and other oil system faults shall be implemented with alarms and trips as appropriate.

verification.acceptance: Oil system protective logic is implemented and verified by functional testing.

requirements.text: The control system shall provide a means for controlled valve testing (partial stroke or functional checks) without compromising safety or causing unacceptable process disturbances.

verification.acceptance: Valve test functions exist and are demonstrated without unsafe impacts; procedures define limits and restoration.

requirements.text: Trip bypass or maintenance override functions, if provided, shall be strictly controlled (keyed, time-limited, alarmed) and recorded to prevent inadvertent loss of protection.

verification.acceptance: Bypass controls require authorization, are alarmed/recorded, and bypass tests demonstrate correct indication and restoration.

requirements.text: The control system shall provide local manual control capability for essential functions (trip, valve close, turning gear control) consistent with plant operations philosophy.

verification.acceptance: Local controls exist and function as intended; verified by commissioning tests.

requirements.text: Remote manual trip capability from the control room shall be provided where required, with clear indication of trip status and reset conditions.

verification.acceptance: Remote trip functions and indications are provided and verified by functional test.

requirements.text: Where coupled to a generator, turbine control shall coordinate with generator breaker status and electrical protective relays to manage synchronization and load rejection events.

verification.acceptance: Coordination logic is documented and tested; load rejection/synchronization interlocks function correctly.

requirements.text: The governing system shall implement droop or isochronous modes as required, with controlled transitions and stability across the operating range.

verification.acceptance: Mode control and stability are demonstrated via test/analysis; transitions are controlled and documented.

requirements.text: Extraction or admission control (if applicable) shall be integrated with turbine governing to prevent instability and protect against reverse flow or overpressure.

verification.acceptance: Extraction control logic is documented and validated; protective interlocks prevent reverse flow/overpressure.

requirements.text: Control power supplies shall be designed with redundancy and ride-through capability as required to avoid loss of control/protection during electrical disturbances.

verification.acceptance: Power supply design meets redundancy/ride-through requirements and is verified by test/inspection.

requirements.text: The turbine control system shall include time synchronization and event recording resolution sufficient for trip analysis and root-cause investigation.

verification.acceptance: Event recorder/historian provides required resolution and time synchronization; verified in commissioning.

requirements.text: Where digital controls are used, the system shall include diagnostics for I/O health, communications integrity, and watchdog functions, with defined failover behavior.

verification.acceptance: Diagnostics and failover functions are implemented and verified by functional tests and failure simulations where practicable.

requirements.text: Control logic and protection setpoints shall be under configuration control with documented rationale, approval, and change history.

verification.acceptance: Setpoint/logic changes require formal approval; configuration records show current values and history.

requirements.text: The turbine shall provide a safe restart/relatch logic following a trip that prevents re-admission of steam until permissives are satisfied and trip cause is cleared.

verification.acceptance: Restart logic is validated by functional tests; steam admission is blocked until all permissives are satisfied.

requirements.text: The control system shall implement protective limits for differential expansion, casing expansion, and other thermal parameters where required by turbine design.

verification.acceptance: Thermal parameter protection channels are implemented and verified by functional tests and calibration.

requirements.text: Communication interfaces between turbine controls and plant systems (DCS, historian) shall be defined, secured, and tested to prevent data loss or unsafe commands.

verification.acceptance: Interface requirements are documented and interface testing demonstrates correct operation and access controls.

requirements.text: The turbine shall provide provisions for periodic functional testing of trip solenoids, valves, and sensors without compromising equipment integrity.

verification.acceptance: Test procedures exist and functional tests demonstrate ability to test components without damage or unsafe conditions.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include a machinery protection and condition monitoring system consistent with the selected protection standard and plant requirements.

verification.acceptance: A machinery protection system is provided with documented channel list and functional tests verifying operation.

requirements.text: Vibration monitoring shall be provided for each bearing using proximity probes or equivalent sensors, with alarm and trip setpoints based on design limits.

verification.acceptance: Installed probes and setpoints are verified by calibration and functional test; setpoints trace to limits.

requirements.text: A keyphasor or speed reference signal shall be provided for vibration phase, balancing, and overspeed/protection functions, with redundancy as required.

verification.acceptance: Keyphasor/speed reference is provided, validated, and configured with required redundancy.

requirements.text: Bearing metal temperature instrumentation shall be provided for all journal and thrust bearings, with alarms and trips as required by protection philosophy.

verification.acceptance: Temperature channels are installed and verified; alarms/trips activate at configured setpoints.

requirements.text: Axial position measurement shall be provided for the rotor with alarms and trips consistent with thrust bearing design limits.

verification.acceptance: Axial position sensor and setpoints are installed and verified; trip tests confirm response.

requirements.text: Differential expansion measurement shall be provided where required for large machines to detect thermal bow and prevent rubbing.

verification.acceptance: Differential expansion sensors and alarm/trip functions are installed and verified.

requirements.text: Casing expansion measurement shall be provided where required to support thermal alignment and rub prevention.

verification.acceptance: Casing expansion measurements are provided and validated; alarms/trips configured where applicable.

requirements.text: Eccentricity (rotor bow) monitoring shall be provided when required to support safe startup and to prevent rubs.

verification.acceptance: Eccentricity monitoring exists and alarm/trip limits are configured; verified by functional test.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include steam condition monitoring (pressure/temperature at inlet, reheat, extraction as applicable) sufficient to verify operating envelope compliance.

verification.acceptance: Instrumentation list includes required steam condition measurements and is validated during commissioning.

requirements.text: Condenser vacuum/exhaust pressure monitoring shall be provided for condensing turbines, with alarms for vacuum degradation and associated performance impacts.

verification.acceptance: Vacuum/exhaust pressure measurements are provided and alarms are functional tested.

requirements.text: Lube oil system monitoring shall include pressure, temperature, flow, filter differential pressure, and reservoir level with alarms/trips as appropriate.

verification.acceptance: Oil system channels are implemented and verified by calibration and functional tests.

requirements.text: Valve position monitoring shall be provided for stop/control/intercept valves (where supplied) to support control, diagnostics, and protection.

verification.acceptance: Valve position feedback is provided and validated; discrepancies generate alarms as specified.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include instrumentation and data collection sufficient to support online or periodic performance monitoring (heat rate/efficiency trending).

verification.acceptance: Performance monitoring parameters are identified and data is available for trending and analysis.

requirements.text: Condition monitoring data shall be recorded and retained with sufficient resolution and duration to support trip analysis and long-term trending.

verification.acceptance: Historian/event recorder retains required channels and resolution; verified during commissioning.

requirements.text: Instrumentation channels important to protection shall be periodically calibrated and include calibration access provisions without major disassembly.

verification.acceptance: Calibration procedures exist and physical access supports calibration intervals; verified by inspection.

requirements.text: Instrumentation and cabling shall be installed and routed to minimize EMI/RFI susceptibility and mechanical damage, consistent with plant practices.

verification.acceptance: Installation practices and routing meet plant requirements; verified by inspection and as-built documentation.

requirements.text: Where required, safety-related or qualified channels shall meet environmental qualification and seismic requirements commensurate with their classification.

verification.acceptance: Qualification records exist for designated channels and are traceable to environment/seismic profiles.

requirements.text: The turbine shall provide local indicators (pressure, temperature, oil parameters) as needed for safe local operation and maintenance troubleshooting.

verification.acceptance: Local indicators are provided and match operations/maintenance needs; verified by inspection.

requirements.text: The machinery protection system shall provide alarm and trip annunciation locally and in the control room as required by plant operations philosophy.

verification.acceptance: Annunciation is present in required locations and verified by functional tests.

requirements.text: The protection system shall provide self-diagnostics (sensor fault detection, channel health) and alarming for failed or bypassed protection channels.

verification.acceptance: Diagnostic alarms are implemented and verified by fault injection tests where practicable.

requirements.text: The system shall support automated generation of periodic condition reports (vibration spectra, trends) or defined manual analysis workflow.

verification.acceptance: Condition monitoring workflow is defined and supported by available data and tools.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include provisions for periodic in-situ probe checks or verification of sensor mounting and gap settings for proximity probes.

verification.acceptance: Probe verification procedures exist and probe checks confirm acceptable gaps and mounting integrity.

requirements.text: Instrumentation required for contractual performance tests shall meet accuracy requirements and be traceable to calibration standards.

verification.acceptance: Calibration certificates demonstrate accuracy and traceability for performance test instruments.

requirements.text: The monitoring system shall provide secure access control and audit logging for configuration changes to protection setpoints and channel definitions.

verification.acceptance: Access control and audit logs exist for configuration changes; verified by audit/inspection.

requirements.text: Where remote monitoring is implemented, data interfaces shall be defined and validated to avoid data loss and protect integrity of condition monitoring data.

verification.acceptance: Remote monitoring interfaces are defined and tested; data integrity checks are implemented.

requirements.text: Where classified as Seismic Category I, the turbine and its required auxiliaries (e.g., lube oil, control/protection) shall be qualified for the plant seismic input (SSE) and anchorage design.

verification.acceptance: Seismic qualification documentation demonstrates compliance for the turbine and required auxiliaries, including anchorage details.

requirements.text: Seismic qualification shall address functional performance after the design-basis seismic event for components required to perform a post-event function.

verification.acceptance: Qualification basis includes post-seismic functional requirements and verification evidence.

requirements.text: Seismic anchorage and supports shall be designed to accommodate inertia loads, differential motion, and interaction with connected piping without compromising clearances or operability.

verification.acceptance: Anchorage/support analysis demonstrates acceptable stress, displacement, and operability margins.

requirements.text: Where turbine control/protection instrumentation is classified as qualified, environmental qualification shall be provided consistent with applicable profiles and aging assumptions.

verification.acceptance: EQ files exist and include aging, environmental conditions, and test/analysis basis for qualified items.

requirements.text: The turbine design shall include measures to ensure operability under expected ambient conditions (temperature, humidity, dust) for turbine hall environments.

verification.acceptance: Environmental design basis and component ratings demonstrate operability under defined ambient conditions.

requirements.text: The turbine package shall incorporate reliability measures for critical auxiliaries (oil pumps, control power, sensors) consistent with availability targets and criticality.

verification.acceptance: Design includes redundancy/robustness commensurate with targets; documented in reliability assessment or design review.

requirements.text: A failure modes and effects analysis (FMEA) or equivalent reliability assessment shall be performed to identify critical failure points and preventive measures.

verification.acceptance: FMEA/reliability assessment exists and mitigations are incorporated into design or maintenance strategy.

requirements.text: The turbine design shall include protections against overspeed-induced mechanical failure, including independent trips and mechanical integrity margins.

verification.acceptance: Overspeed protection is independent and validated; overspeed integrity margins are documented.

requirements.text: The turbine and auxiliaries shall incorporate fire protection and oil spill mitigation provisions consistent with plant fire protection program.

verification.acceptance: Fire protection and spill mitigation features are provided and documented; interfaces coordinated with plant systems.

requirements.text: The design shall incorporate guarding and access control to reduce personnel hazard from rotating components and hot surfaces.

verification.acceptance: Guarding and insulation features are installed per design and verified by inspection.

requirements.text: Where required by plant hazard evaluations, the turbine shall incorporate flood protection or drainage measures for critical control cabinets and oil systems.

verification.acceptance: Hazard evaluation and design features address flood/water ingress risks for critical components.

requirements.text: The turbine design shall include provisions for post-event inspection (post-seismic or post-trip) including accessible inspection points and defined criteria for return to service.

verification.acceptance: Post-event inspection criteria and access points are defined in procedures/manuals.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include measures to minimize spurious trips while maintaining protective integrity (e.g., voting logic, redundancy, diagnostics).

verification.acceptance: Trip logic design and tests demonstrate acceptable spurious trip susceptibility and protective coverage.

requirements.text: The turbine shall be designed to tolerate expected grid disturbances (frequency/voltage excursions) when coupled to a generator without damaging torsional response.

verification.acceptance: Analyses demonstrate acceptable torsional response for defined grid disturbance cases.

requirements.text: Where the turbine is used for emergency or black start service, design features shall support rapid start and required availability under extended standby conditions.

verification.acceptance: Design and tests demonstrate standby preservation, start reliability, and time-to-load requirements.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include corrosion protection measures suitable for expected ambient and steam conditions, including preservation and layup provisions.

verification.acceptance: Corrosion protection and preservation methods are specified and implemented; verified by inspection and documentation.

requirements.text: The turbine design shall include defined requirements for storage and preservation of spare rotors, blades, seals, and bearings to maintain readiness.

verification.acceptance: Spare parts preservation and storage requirements are defined in manuals/specifications.

requirements.text: The turbine shall be designed to support condition-based maintenance where selected, including sensors and data interfaces needed for predictive diagnostics.

verification.acceptance: Condition-based maintenance enablement is documented and implemented (sensors, data).

requirements.text: Where applicable, the turbine shall meet plant requirements for electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) for control/protection systems.

verification.acceptance: EMC requirements are documented and verified by design review/testing as required.

requirements.text: The turbine control/protection system shall be designed such that loss of a single sensor or channel does not defeat essential protective functions where required by classification.

verification.acceptance: Protection architecture demonstrates continued protective coverage for defined single-channel failures.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include provisions for periodic validation of protection system functionality following maintenance or configuration changes.

verification.acceptance: Functional validation procedures exist and are performed; records demonstrate successful validation.

requirements.text: The turbine shall incorporate measures to limit oil system contamination from external sources (seal leaks, water ingress) and to detect contamination promptly.

verification.acceptance: Design includes contamination control features and monitoring; verification demonstrates detection and mitigation effectiveness.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include measures to prevent steam leaks or hot surface exposure from creating unacceptable workplace hazards, including insulation and shielding.

verification.acceptance: Insulation/shielding is installed and meets safety expectations; verified by inspection.

requirements.text: Where applicable, turbine hall ventilation and heat rejection interfaces shall be considered to maintain environmental conditions within equipment limits.

verification.acceptance: Heat load and ventilation interface considerations are documented and equipment ratings are met.

requirements.text: The turbine package shall include a documented obsolescence management strategy for digital controls and critical instrumentation over the plant life.

verification.acceptance: Obsolescence plan exists and addresses firmware/software, spares, and lifecycle support.

requirements.text: The turbine shall undergo a shop mechanical run test (MRT) demonstrating stable operation at rated speed/load (or equivalent), including vibration and bearing temperature acceptance.

verification.acceptance: Shop MRT results demonstrate vibration and bearing temperatures within acceptance criteria for specified test conditions.

requirements.text: The turbine shall successfully demonstrate overspeed trip testing at the specified setpoint and verify valve closure response and trip logic.

verification.acceptance: Overspeed trip test records show actuation at setpoint and valve closure within required time; logic verified.

requirements.text: Where required, an overspeed mechanical integrity test shall be performed at the specified overspeed test percentage with documented inspection results.

verification.acceptance: Overspeed test records and post-test inspections demonstrate no damage and compliance with acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Factory performance testing, where specified, shall be conducted per ASME PTC 6 with defined instrumentation accuracy and correction methods.

verification.acceptance: PTC 6 performance test report demonstrates compliance with specified output/efficiency within tolerance.

requirements.text: Rotor and critical rotating components shall receive required NDE (UT, MT/PT, etc.) with documented acceptance criteria and results.

verification.acceptance: NDE records and reports exist and meet acceptance criteria for critical components.

requirements.text: Pressure boundary components shall receive required NDE and pressure testing per code-of-record/procurement specification with documented results.

verification.acceptance: NDE and pressure test records demonstrate compliance with acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: The lube oil system shall be flushed and cleaned to defined cleanliness acceptance criteria prior to turbine commissioning.

verification.acceptance: Oil flush records demonstrate achieved cleanliness level and acceptable particulate/moisture levels.

requirements.text: The turbine control and protection system shall undergo factory acceptance testing (FAT) covering all sequences, trips, alarms, and interlocks.

verification.acceptance: FAT procedures and results demonstrate all logic and I/O pass acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Site acceptance testing (SAT) shall be performed to validate integration with plant systems (DCS, protection relays, auxiliaries) and confirm correct indications and controls.

verification.acceptance: SAT results demonstrate correct integration and functional behavior for defined scenarios.

requirements.text: Commissioning tests shall validate correct valve stroking times, valve seating, and position feedback for stop/control/intercept valves.
