verification.acceptance: Valve tests document closure/opening times, seating, and feedback accuracy within acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Commissioning shall include verification of turning gear operation, interlocks, and lubrication modes for cooldown and extended barring operation.

verification.acceptance: Turning gear commissioning tests demonstrate correct operation and interlocks under defined conditions.

requirements.text: Commissioning shall include alignment verification of the turbine train (turbine-coupling-gearbox/generator) and documentation of final alignment readings.

verification.acceptance: Alignment records demonstrate achieved alignment within specified tolerances.

requirements.text: Baseline vibration spectra, phase, and overall levels shall be captured at commissioning for future condition monitoring comparison.

verification.acceptance: Baseline condition monitoring dataset is collected and archived in controlled records.

requirements.text: Baseline performance data (heat rate/efficiency, steam flow) shall be captured at defined operating points for future performance monitoring.

verification.acceptance: Baseline performance dataset is collected, corrected, and archived for trending.

requirements.text: Trip response testing shall verify that required protective actions occur for simulated conditions (high vibration, high bearing temp, low oil pressure, overspeed).

verification.acceptance: Trip tests demonstrate correct protective actions for each simulated condition with recorded response times.

requirements.text: Instrumentation calibration and loop checks shall be performed prior to initial startup, with calibration traceability for instruments used in protection and performance tests.

verification.acceptance: Calibration and loop check records demonstrate traceability and acceptance for required instruments.

requirements.text: The turbine shall be inspected post-run (borescope or physical inspection where feasible) to verify no abnormal rubs, deposits, or damage following initial commissioning.

verification.acceptance: Inspection records document acceptable condition after initial runs and any corrective actions.

requirements.text: Periodic surveillance testing shall be defined for overspeed trip, emergency trip, and key protection channels to ensure ongoing functionality.

verification.acceptance: Surveillance procedures exist with defined frequency and records demonstrate completion and acceptance.

requirements.text: Condition monitoring program requirements shall define data review frequency, alarm response actions, and escalation criteria for abnormal trends.

verification.acceptance: Condition monitoring program documents frequency, response actions, and escalation paths.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include provisions for periodic oil analysis and the program shall define acceptance limits and corrective actions for contamination or degradation.

verification.acceptance: Oil analysis program defines limits and actions; sampling points and records support implementation.

requirements.text: Where applicable, periodic steam path inspections and performance evaluations shall be scheduled based on operating hours, starts, and condition indicators.

verification.acceptance: Inspection/performance evaluation plan exists and is linked to operating history and condition indicators.

requirements.text: Any required inservice examinations of pressure boundary welds or critical parts shall be defined and implemented consistent with code-of-record and plant program.

verification.acceptance: Inservice exam plan exists and examination records are maintained per program requirements.

requirements.text: The turbine shall have defined acceptance criteria for post-maintenance return to service, including vibration, alignment, and trip function checks.

verification.acceptance: Post-maintenance test checklist and criteria exist and records demonstrate completion and acceptance.

requirements.text: All factory and site test results shall be reviewed and accepted under QA controls, and deviations shall be dispositioned through formal nonconformance processes.

verification.acceptance: QA review records exist and NCRs/deviations are dispositioned and closed with documented justification.

requirements.text: The turbine commissioning package shall include as-left setpoints, calibration records, and a complete turnover dossier for operations.

verification.acceptance: Turnover package includes as-left configuration and test records under document control.

requirement_sets.category: 12. Quality assurance, procurement, records, and maintainability

requirements.text: Suppliers providing turbine equipment or services important to nuclear safety shall implement a QA program meeting applicable QA requirements (e.g., Appendix B, ASME NQA-1, ISO 19443) as invoked by procurement documents.

verification.acceptance: Supplier QA program is evaluated/approved and meets invoked requirements; audit records maintained.

requirements.text: Procurement specifications shall identify technical requirements, applicable standards, hold points, and required supplier documentation for the turbine and auxiliaries.

verification.acceptance: Procurement package includes defined requirements, standards, and supplier data submittal list.

requirements.text: Commercial-grade items used in safety-related turbine applications shall be dedicated using a documented commercial grade dedication (CGD) process and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: CGD plans and acceptance evidence exist for applicable items and are retained in QA records.

requirements.text: Material traceability shall be maintained from heat/lot to installed component for critical rotating parts and pressure boundary components as required by procurement and QA classification.

verification.acceptance: Traceability records demonstrate linkage from material certs to installed items.

requirements.text: Supplier manufacturing plans shall include inspection and test plans (ITPs) with defined witness/hold points for critical operations (forging, heat treat, NDE, balance, run test).

verification.acceptance: ITPs exist with appropriate hold points and are executed with documented results.

requirements.text: Nonconformances and deviations shall be documented, evaluated for technical impact, and dispositioned through formal processes with approvals consistent with QA requirements.

verification.acceptance: NCR/deviation records exist with technical evaluations and approvals; dispositions implemented and verified.

requirements.text: Design changes affecting turbine performance, protection setpoints, or configuration shall be controlled via a documented change control process including technical review and approvals.

verification.acceptance: Change control records exist and demonstrate review/approval and updated as-built documentation.

requirements.text: Software/firmware used in turbine control/protection shall be subject to lifecycle controls (versioning, verification, change impact assessment, rollback plan) per plant QA program.

verification.acceptance: Software/firmware configuration records and verification evidence exist and meet invoked lifecycle controls.

requirements.text: Document control shall ensure turbine drawings, manuals, and procedures are current, accessible, and reflect the as-built/as-left configuration.

verification.acceptance: Controlled documents are current and match as-built/as-left configuration; document control audits support compliance.

requirements.text: Records retention requirements for turbine QA, testing, and qualification records shall be defined and implemented consistent with regulatory and plant program requirements.

verification.acceptance: Records retention schedule and storage meet program requirements; records are retrievable.

requirements.text: Procurement shall require vendor to provide recommended spare parts lists, long-lead spares, and critical spares to support availability targets.

verification.acceptance: Spare parts lists and critical spares recommendations are provided and reviewed against availability targets.

requirements.text: The design shall provide adequate access for routine inspection and maintenance (bearing inspection, valve maintenance, probe calibration) without requiring major disassembly.

verification.acceptance: GA drawings and maintenance procedures demonstrate access for routine tasks.

requirements.text: The turbine shall provide lifting lugs, jack points, and rigging provisions for safe removal/installation of major components (upper casing, rotor, valves).

verification.acceptance: Rigging provisions are present and rated; maintenance instructions describe their use.

requirements.text: Special tools and fixtures required for turbine maintenance (rotor stands, alignment tools, seal installation tools) shall be identified and provided or specified.

verification.acceptance: Special tooling list exists and required tools/fixtures are provided or sourced.

requirements.text: The turbine shall include provisions for controlled preservation and layup (desiccant ports, nitrogen purge, heaters) to prevent corrosion during outages or storage.

verification.acceptance: Layup provisions are present and layup procedures are provided and feasible.

requirements.text: Shipping and storage requirements shall include shock/vibration limits, humidity controls, and inspection upon receipt criteria to ensure equipment integrity.

verification.acceptance: Shipping/storage requirements are documented and receiving inspection criteria are defined and performed.

requirements.text: Receiving inspection shall verify key attributes (nameplate, damage, preservation status, documentation completeness) prior to installation.

verification.acceptance: Receiving inspection checklist and records demonstrate completion and resolution of findings.

requirements.text: Training materials and maintenance manuals shall include clear procedures for trip reset, valve maintenance, oil system maintenance, and condition monitoring interpretation.

verification.acceptance: Manuals/training materials include required procedures and are accepted by plant maintenance organization.

requirements.text: The turbine shall support ALARA and worker safety by minimizing unnecessary maintenance exposure through modular design, remote test points, and reduced need for intrusive inspections.

verification.acceptance: Design features and procedures reduce intrusive work; ALARA considerations are documented where applicable.

requirements.text: Qualification records (seismic/EQ) for qualified components shall be maintained and retrievable, including test reports, analyses, and aging evaluations.

verification.acceptance: Qualification files exist and are retrievable; contents meet program expectations.

requirements.text: Periodic supplier audits and/or surveillances shall be conducted commensurate with QA classification to verify continued compliance with QA program requirements.

verification.acceptance: Audit/surveillance schedule and reports demonstrate oversight and closure of findings.

requirements.text: The project shall establish and maintain a parts obsolescence plan for long-lived turbine control electronics, sensors, and specialty spares.

verification.acceptance: Obsolescence plan identifies at-risk items and mitigation actions (spares, redesign, vendor support).

requirements.text: Calibration and test equipment used for turbine acceptance and surveillance shall be controlled and traceable to calibration standards.

verification.acceptance: Calibration program records show traceability and in-tolerance status for test equipment.

requirements.text: Vendor and site personnel performing special processes (welding, NDE, balancing) shall be qualified and records maintained per invoked standards.

verification.acceptance: Qualification records exist for special process personnel and are verified during audits/inspections.

requirements.text: The turbine maintenance and surveillance program shall include periodic review of operating experience and condition monitoring data to update preventive maintenance tasks.

verification.acceptance: Maintenance program includes periodic review and updates based on operating experience and monitoring data.
